summary: genetic studies suggest that MERS-CoV evolved from bat coronaviruses to cause human infection in 2012. of the first 1082 cases, 1054 (97%) were identified in the Arabian Peninsula. most cases are a result of transmission in hospitals from patients with unrecognized illness to other patients, visitors and health care workers who are in close contact. the syndrome is diagnosed by submitting nasopharyngeal swabs, sputum or bronchoalveolar lavage specimens from patients with relevant travel or exposure histories to public health laboratories. prompt diagnosis, private room accommodation, droplet and contact precautions prevent transmission.2,4–6 Community transmission is uncommon.
